# Steps to reproduce & Expected behavior

In the command line Ctrl+Left Arrow should jump a word to the left.  Ctrl+Shift+Left Arrow should select the word to the left.  None of this seems to work.

```

# Actual behavior

The terminal command line just moves the cursor left or right by one character, no matter what command is used.

```

comments.body: By `Ingegrated Console` do you mean the VS Code integrated console? That is an entirely separate project, maintained in the **vscode-powershell** repo. The limitations of the integrated console there are well-known, and are well on the way to being rectified. I believe prototype versions of the extension are available from the repo and/or their AppVeyor build artifacts which _do_ include PSReadLine support and thus have these issues largely resolved.

comments.author: jagdishrajan
comments.body: Sorry, I should have created this in vscode-powershell repo.  Closing this issue as it does not pertain to PowerShell console v6.

title: Simple keyboard editing commands don't work in in PowerShell Integrated Console
